newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Bankers Trust NZ reports 11 pct yr profit rise.
newsitem.headline: Bankers Trust NZ reports 11 pct yr profit rise.

text.p: Bankers Trust New Zealand announced an 11 percent rise in the bank's after-tax profit for the year to December to NZ$26.7 million, the New Zealand Press Association reported on Wednesday.
The bank, a unit of Bankers Trust NY Corp, said growth of its fund management business had been important for its growth in 1996.
The bank's result was achieved on a 7 percent rise in operating revenues to $80.8 million, but operating expenses were up 15.5 percent at $33.51 million.

At balance date the bank had total assets of $4.3 billion, from $2.16 billion a year ago, and for the seventh consecutive year had neither written any debts off, nor made any provision for doubtful debts, Chief Executive Gavin Walker said.
At balance date shareholders' funds were worth $183 million from $161 million a year ago.
The biggest changes in the bank's balance sheet were a $1.8 billion increase in debts from related parties to $1.917 billion, and a $1.03 billion rise in deposits to $2.14 billion.
Cash and money-market placements were up at $535 million from $31.23 million, as were fixed assets at $8.08 million from $1.95 million. Trading securities were down at $291 million from $859 million.
Trading securities Bankers Trust was liable for increased to $281 million from $4 million, while debts to related parties were up at $1.37 billion from $725 million.
The bank's total capital adequacy was 20.67 percent, 2.6 times that required by the Reserve Bank.
